Title: Flooding & Flood Zones
Data source:
Flooding Survey
 Based on Nov. 11, 2012 interim data from the FEMA Modeling Task Force Hurricane Sandy Impact Analysis（http://fema.maps.arcgis.com/home/item.html?id=307dd522499d4a44a33d7296a5da5ea0), which combines detailed elevation data with U.S. Geological Survey inspections of high water marks.(http://www.usgs.gov/blogs/features/usgs_top_story/sandy/)
 Flood Zones
 Coastline inundation zones calculated by the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers using worst-case storm, wave and tide calculations together with elevation data. View the New Jersey hurricane evacuation studies, and the New York state evacuation studies. In New York City, the state zones are superseded by the city's own evacuation zones, which draw from the USACE surveys.

Title: Poverty Tracker
Data source: These statistics emerge from a survey developed by Columbia University and Robin Hood to provide a more accurate picture of poverty in New York City. The survey pool came from a fixed panel of approximately 2,300 residents from the five boroughs, many from families living in poverty (those with an annual income of less than $11,722 per year for individuals and $23,497 for a family of four).
